unnormalised: **Vrindavan Prepares for Record Crowd on Janmashtami**
normalised: Vrindavan Prepares for Record Crowd on Janmashtami

unnormalised: Vrindavan, Mathura – The holy city of Vrindavan is bracing itself for an unprecedented influx of pilgrims expected to arrive for Janmashtami celebrations on 06/09/2024. Local authorities are estimating over 10 lakh devotees will throng the temples and streets, marking a significant increase compared to previous years. Enhanced security measures and traffic diversions are being implemented to manage the anticipated congestion.
normalised: Vrindavan, Mathura – The holy city of Vrindavan is bracing itself for an unprecedented influx of pilgrims expected to arrive for Janmashtami celebrations on sixth september two thousand and twenty four. Local authorities are estimating over ten lakh devotees will throng the temples and streets, marking a significant increase compared to previous years. Enhanced security measures and traffic diversions are being implemented to manage the anticipated congestion.

unnormalised: The Shri Krishna Janmasthan Temple, Prem Mandir, and ISKCON Vrindavan are among the key locations expected to witness the highest footfall. Temple administrations are working in close coordination with district officials to ensure the smooth flow of devotees and maintain order. Volunteers will be stationed at strategic points to provide assistance and guidance. Special pujas and aartis are scheduled throughout the day, culminating in the midnight celebration marking Lord Krishna’s birth. Live telecasts will be available on DD National and other channels.

Special pujas and aartis are scheduled throughout the day, culminating in the midnight celebration marking Lord Krishna’s birth. Live telecasts will be available on D-D National and other channels.

unnormalised: Concerns have been raised regarding accommodation capacity, with most hotels and guesthouses already fully booked. Temporary shelters and community halls are being prepared to accommodate the overflow. The Mathura-Vrindavan Development Authority (MVDA) has also set up information kiosks and helpline numbers to assist pilgrims with travel and lodging arrangements. District Magistrate Navneet Chahal urged visitors to adhere to safety guidelines and cooperate with the authorities.

unnormalised: Transportation arrangements have been bolstered with the deployment of additional buses and auto-rickshaws. However, authorities are advising pilgrims to use public transport and avoid bringing private vehicles to the city center. Designated parking zones have been established on the outskirts of Vrindavan to minimize traffic snarls. The Railways have also announced special trains to Mathura from major cities, including Delhi, Mumbai, and Kolkata.

unnormalised: Medical teams and ambulances will be stationed at various locations to provide immediate assistance in case of emergencies. Camps offering free food and water are being set up by various religious and charitable organizations. The district administration has appealed to all visitors to maintain cleanliness and respect the sanctity of the holy city during the Janmashtami celebrations. The meteorological department has forecast a partly cloudy day with temperatures expected to reach a high of 32°C.
